org.drupal.project.computing

Class DCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drupal.project.computing.DCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Void>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EchoCommand

    public abstract class DCommand
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Void>
    Individual command to be executed. Most often developers will write subclass of this class. So the interface has to be very simple and easy to understand. You need to overrides 2 methods: 1. prepare(): initialize input from a Bindings object. 2. execute(): execute the command.

    • Method Detail

      • prepare

        public abstract void prepare(javax.script.Bindings input)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Prepare the command by taking data from "input" and set internal states. Design decisions: 1. There's no "abstract static method" in Java, so we can't use factory method pattern (unless we have a separate Factory class, which is not needed) 2. There's no "abstract constructor" to force a constructor that takes Bindings as input. 3. Therefore, we can only pass in Input Bindings in a regular abstract function, which means the object has to be initialized first, which means we can't have other types of constructors (except for the the default constructor). 4. Therefore, this method "prepare" is the only entry to initialize an DCommand object.
        Parameters:
        input - data from DRecord.input.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • execute

        public abstract void execute()
                      throws DCommandExecutionException
        this is the core of DCommand. Execute the command after fully initialized from Input data. We expect execute() to run successfully. If an error occurs, throw an exception. Execution should also write to "message" and "result" to pass results back to DApplication.
        Throws:
        DCommandExecutionException

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
